data.title: Geoffrey Lewis – Forgotten Films
data.meta_description: Posts about Geoffrey Lewis written by thesquonk
data.text:
It is time for us to return to the valley of the Coreys. That’s right, smack in the middle of the eight or so films that Corey Feldman and Corey Haim made together, there was one that bore the name National Lampoon. My guess is the pair saw that this particular vehicle took place at... Continue Reading →

In November of 1983, ABC aired what was one of the definitive moments of 80’s television. The notorious movie “The Day After.” It was about the aftermath of a nuclear attack on America. I was 12 years old at the time, and I wanted nothing to do with it. Just the print ad in TV... Continue Reading →

My parents enjoy movies, but they have never been as big about movie watching as I am. But one movie I do remember that they “passed down” to me was “The Sting,” and it remains one of my favorite films. It won the Best Picture Oscar for 1973 and was the second highest grossing movie... Continue Reading →
